Reviews.Title: “A real dump!”
Reviews.Author: susan m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place recently and found it to be a real dump. The suite I stayed in for 2 nights had water radiator that kept dripping so I called the front desk and they sent in the maid who wrapped a towel around the pipe and taped it and then put a cloth on the carpet to keep it dry. How primitive. The thing dripped for 2 days and the suite took on a tenement atmosphere. Eventually the heater broke down so the front desk brought me a small heater to plug in. . I wanted to move to another suite but the one they showed me smelled like a horse's stable. I moved to another room and it was close to their pub and the noise from the music was very loud and pulsating so I asked for another room. This room was on a floor they were renovating with tiles and was a mess. To get to your room you had to walk over boards and tiles and plaster and it was a safety hazard too. I asked for another room and ended up in one of their older rooms which stunk like body odor PLUS in the bathroom At this point, I was tired and took the room for one last night. Luckily, I had some good room spray on me so it helped. But in any of their rooms I ever stayed in there was always the pungent smell of sulphur coming out of the bathrrom drains. The maids were surly and belligerent and a few times it sounded like their was a hen fight going on in the courtyard as they hollered at each other back and forth. They offer a continental breakfast for $ 7 which is overpriced. It was served by a woman who does not speak English very well and the coffee was gross and the food stale. I would avoid this place in the future. Pay a bit more for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations, considering what I paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barclay quite a few times over the years, and it offers good accommodation for the budget traveler (if you are not picky, of course). The rooms are not necessarily the cleanest and the hotel is very dated, but the service is efficient. They always accommodated an early check-in when I arrived in the morning which was greatly appreciated. I will likely not return in the future, as I now like to splurge on occasion, but as a budget, single traveler in the past I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Vancouver!!!”
Reviews.Author: Panichew
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel for 3 weeks as it was the only hotel that offered me a very good price as a travel agent!!!! the hotel is very very old, and needs a renovations ASAP. during the time i stayed i did not mind it as my budget was very limit and i was only 25 yrs old.. the hotel is located on Robson Street a very lively street full of shops, coffee shops, resaurants.... everything is there!!!! i dont recommend this hotel to families, i recommend it only to students or low budget people. futher more we had a lovely time in Vancouver, its such a lovely city so we did not mind about the hotel standard..... dont forget to rent a car and visit Whistler Mountain and Seattle...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ordinary stuff”
Reviews.Author: amgriffiths
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barclay as part of a group travelling for work. First impressions not good - the lobby looks and smells tired; there is no lift, so we had to lug suitcases up several flights of stairs. The rooms are basic and functional; we had no inclination to spend more time in them than strictly necessary. There is a continental breakfast (not included, but not expensive) which veers between the dubious and the acceptable. On the plus side, free wifi, though it is somewhat temperamental. The main draws here are the location and (I imagine) the low rates. But if your priorities are anything other than these, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute substitute for the Patricia Hotel which was a complete and utter dump which I gave 1 star on trip advisor. The Barclay Hotel was a step up from the terrible category to the poor category. We stayed here 1 night. It is very dated and small. The cleanliness was below average. The location is ok. (Depending where you want to go obviously). If you want the bars a bit more trendy with good restaurants you need to be in Yale town. There is parking. Can't remember how much it cost. It was no more than $10 per night. This hotel would be best suited for a solo male that needs a cheap head down for the night. I wouldn't recommend for couples, family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, safe neighborhood, medicre comfort”
Reviews.Author: DaCouv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really well situated on Robson Street so if restaurants and shopping are your thing then you're in a good spot. It's a fairly touristy area, the red shuttle trolleys stop across the street to tour you around town and since it's fairly central you're close to most all of the destinations. Now for the "mediocre comfort" part. Our particular room, I believe, was the cheapest room in this hotel so consider that when reading this. (We walked around the hotel and peeked in a few other more expensive rooms and they looked much bigger and nicer). Our room was the smallest hotel I've ever stayed in; there was barely enough room for the bed and very little walking around space. The bathroom was also very small and in some places there was some minor damage (broken floor tiles). The room did seem clean, but my biggest complaint was the bed. It was very hard and sunken in right in the middle. No matter what you tried, you'd always end up rolling back in - kind of like sleeping in a bowl. The TV was broken and made everyone's head look huge and there is also no elevator so pack light. Am I complaining? Sort of but not really - it's good for seeing Vancouver on a budget and if we wanted luxury we'd stay up the street at one of the big towers and pay double. The service was actually quite good; the man at the front desk did not speak much English but he was friendly and when our toilet got stuck he offered to come up and plunge it (to which I basically said, thanks but I think I should do it myself). Also, the man downstairs in the lounge actually offered to warm up some leftovers for us in his microwave in the back - he didn't have to do that and I think he went above and beyond the call of duty. I'd probably look into staying here again, but I would opt for a larger room and hope the bed isn't a bowl-bed.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel + great location = very good value”
Reviews.Author: BRADHILL Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Could have paid same amount for better quality at airport or North Vancouver but was persuaded to stay downtown. As we were on a budget this meant compromising but this hotel was ideal due to great location. Rooms were ok - don't book if you want luxury - just clean and comfortable. Air con was needed but was like a tractor so good job we are heavy sleepers. No lifts so a bind getting luggage to room on 2nd floor. Reception staff were great - welcoming/ friendly and helpful. This feature, low cost and location made the stay perfect for us. A short walk from all the best of Vancouver - 2 doors down from bike rental and amidst shops etc. Parking (unsecured) on site for small fee

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Vancouver for people on a budget”
Reviews.Author: morts109
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here and thought it was great value for money. Staff were friendly and the rooms clean and well furnished. Location is also perfect- right on Robson Street, the main shopping street but at the same time there was no problem with noise. Breakfast is not included but can be bought for a reasonable price - although breakfast was average and there are probably better alternatives at nearby cafes. Hotel staff were always very helpful

Reviews.Title: “hot and bothered”
Reviews.Author: minakom1224
Reviews.Content: No elevator, lots of stairs, dated rooms, room gets too hot at night and very cold in the morning. The beds were not made to hotel standard and reception desk didn't connect our incoming calls. We drove from Washington so obviously we had a car but nowhere to park but on the streets. Don't think we'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: runawayvespa
Reviews.Content: For $49 a night (plus tax) this is a great basic hotel. If you want luxury and a large room then pay a bit more. I am someone who would rather spend my money sightseeing than on accommodation. The rooms were small and basic, but clean, tidy and warm. It is a convenient location, surrounded by restaurant and shops, with a bus stop and convenience store within the block. Location is important in Vancouver, as some of the other cheap hotels I looked into were in the Downtown Eastside, a very scary neighbourhood. We did have to pay $15 a night to park our car in a nearby hotel, as their parking lot was being used for renovations.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: gigiduru
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with relatively good rates in a good location but other than that nothing to be excited. Old outdates hotel with no elevator although is a 3 storey hotel. Tiny bathroom without sink which is in the bedroom .Room was clean but with outdated furniture like the all hotel.For sure there are better choices for same price and although no major inconveniences one time was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: dannygirl26
Reviews.Content: The requested ground-floor room was not available so we were given an up-graded room. The room was large, clean and comfortable with a king-size bed. Only two small bars of soap in the bathroom. No other toiletries. Would have been nice to have tea and coffee making facilities. The continental breakfast was good value. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. Gave us advice on where to go and booked a taxi for us when we left. The location of the hotel was convenient for the hop-on hop-off bus. Would go again if in Vancoiver.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no amenities.”
Reviews.Author: ptooze
Reviews.Content: This place is ok if you just want a place to sleep. There are absolutely no amenities.Although, It is centrally located with restaurants and nightlife within easy walking distance. If you are in any way shape or form disabled be warned, there are no elevators and there is no wheel chair access into the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: rachandfil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2009 for 3 nights. The first night we were subjected to 3 Canadian girls arguing violently in the hallway until 3am - the hotel staff did not call the police as they repeatedly threatened that they would. Room was old and basic (which was expected of the price) but after a day, we notice blood stains on the sheets and bites around our ankles. The ceilings were also really thin and we could hear everything happening above us. Would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hasile
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and especially liked the location on Robson street. Stanley Park and downtown are only a short walk away. The hotel itself has small rooms but they are totally sufficient if you just sleep there. Staff was friendly and helpful. If you want to you can have continental breakfast in a pub in the basement of the hotel (but we didn´t try). This hotel is excellent if you need a place to sleep for a reasonable price, without any luxury . We would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but served it purpose. Beware the stairs though!”
Reviews.Author: Quaifeclan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and the room was very basic - no tea or coffee making facilities, the air conditioner didn't work and the room was very small and stuffy. We were on the 1st floor (our ground floor) at the back so it was nice and quiet, but the hotel is full of stairs which could be a problem if you have heavy cases (as we did) or are less mobile. If there was a lift I didn't see it! Even getting into the hotel was up a flight of stairs. The location is good - right inthe middle of Robson Street. The buffet style breakfast was again pretty basic, but very cheap, and in Vancouver this is a real plus! The staff were for the most part friendly and capable. A good place to stay if you are prepared for budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and blood stains on the sheets!”
Reviews.Author: annabanana1981
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this disgusting hotel for one night only..which was more than enough and a complete waste of our money. We may have been better off staying the night on East Hastings Street! Both of our twin beds had blood stains on the fitted sheet, which we discovered when we were packing up to leave, and neither of us had an open wound AT ALL. Also, the week that we were back home, we started getting horrible itchy bites. Our doctors confirmed that they were bed bug bites. When I phoned to speak to a manager, the person told me I would have to call back between the hours of 7am and 9am. When I began to explain my situation to him, he said you will have to speak to the manager...and then hung up on me. Spread the word people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just awful !”
Reviews.Author: daisy9Otago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is seriously in need of renovation - the toilet cistern in our bathroom did not shut off, so we were shifted to another room. The second room had a slightly cleaner carpet than the first one, but it was right above a nightclub and terribly noisy. We had to have the windows open as we would have suffocated otherwise! No hairdryers in the room. We stored our luggage at reception for half a day and when we went back to retrieve it, the staff were unable to find it (they finally found it in one of the bedrooms!) Not to be recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneWayfarer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Whilst the hotel is in need of refurbishment it was, never the less comfortable. The hotel is on Robson Street and is very close to numerous restaurants and also only a short stroll to Stanley Park. Staff were very polite and helpful. We had a room at the rear of the premises and therefore it was nice and quiet, no street noise. For the cost, it is very good value in this high priced city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: BenS89
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barclay for 3 nights after a week at Whistler in Feb. Was the worst accommodation I have ever stayed in. The staff were pretty weird to begin with, and not very helpful. Just stared oddly whenever we walked past. The room was quite large, but was incredibly musty and had a distinct smell of urine which no amount of deoderant could spray away. I was woken up by my buddy who sounded like he was choking to death. Turns out he was having an asthma attack, which he hasn't had in years. We threw off all the musty blankets and opened the windows so he could breathe. Then we had colds for the rest of our trip thanks to the chilly Vancouver air. I strongly urge you never to stay here. It's not even worth the measly price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely nothing wrong with hotel!”
Reviews.Author: boxingnun7158
Reviews.Content: While this hotel might not be for everyone, there is nothing wrong with it! The decor is dated and yes, there is no elevator and the television is small. But when you are paying $40 a night in the best part of town, you shouldn't expect 4 star luxury! It was impeccably clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the shower pressure and temp was perfect. And while the decor is dated, I wouldn't say that it is depressing. It just sort of looks like your grandmother decorated the place. The staff was very polite and helpful. I will agree with the person that said to avoid the "continental breakfast," as it is about $5.95 and really just carbs (muffins, toaster waffles, etc.). You get a better deal from Starbucks or a fast food chain. As a traveller, I'm pretty laid back. As long as the place is clean and I can sleep in the bed, I'm pretty happy. If you're looking for one of the better deals in Vancouver, this place is it. If you're looking for luxury, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: adderi
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a great location and price which is why we booked it. We had low expectations and it was nice that they had a TV in the room. The rooms were old and quite small. I would stay here again, but after checking the prices from the other close by hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of character !”
Reviews.Author: slacks56
Reviews.Content: As the suites at the Barclay contain two double beds, I thought it would be a good idea for our party (two couples) to book one for an overnight stay, as they are very cheap. I didn't anticipate that both double beds would be in the same room !! The other room which was huge, contained some extremely odd wooden furniture, a small TV and the biggest fireplace I've ever seen - just the ticket when it's 80 degrees outside. Anyway if you can see beyond the extremely individual room arrangements, there didn't seem to be much wrong with the Barclay. The rooms were clean enough, everything in the bathroom seemed to work and the buffet breakfast in the bar downstairs was cheap and cheerful. Another interesting point about the hotel is its position, right in the middle of the Robson Street nightlife. Having just flown in from London on a very hot night, we had to have the windows open and we went to bed at 9 pm. We then woke up at approx. 1 am to what sounded like a football crowd down below in the bar. This noise went on until about 2 am when everybody but the odd drunk wandered off. All in all, quite one of the most quirky hotels I've ever stayed in - certainly an experience !

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yeung
Reviews.Content: On the 26th of August me and my husband checked in in this hotel. After checking in, we realized that this hotel hasn't got a lift! We needed to carry our bags and suitcases waked on the wood stairs to the 3rd floor. meanwhile we heard the "Gegege" from the old wood steps. when we stood in front of the door, we saw the lock of the door is very old one (wih a normal key not an IC card). after entering the room, both of shook! no closet only hooks on the wall. old wood table and look dirty!! the room stink, a very small window facing to the street and the window has no lock too! there is a very 14" TV at the corner of the room, just on the left hand side or our beds. since it was late we have checked in already, we decided to stay for the night. But it was horrible, during the night, we were woke up by the steps from upper floor. we heard every step where people walking upstairs!!!! I think that 's because the whole hotels was built by wood and it is very old!!!! for us, it was a nightmare, especally after a long distance flight . we expected to have a good sleep. By the way, we have booked this hotel from a Swiss travel agency named: Globetrotter.

Reviews.Title: “Room to swing a cat?!”
Reviews.Author: purplewelshwood
Reviews.Content: After searching the net for hotels in Vancouver and contacting many with no luck I looked in my rough guide to Canada and the Barclay was the first I rang, I was so desperate that I was glad they had a room but had a funny feeling so for the first time during my 3 week trip refused to look at this website. My funny feeling turned out to be right. We arrived at the Barclay in a taxi, compared to neighbouring hotels from the outside it looked very dingy. Inside the lobby there were suitcases everywhere, which showed that they lacked space downstairs. The receptionist was polite, i'm unsure whether they didnt have the room I'd booked but she offered me one $20 cheaper, which I accepted as we were on a budget. The first drawback was that they did not have a lift so we had to drag our bags up 3 flights of stairs(not what you want to do after a 12 hour trip on the night bus!) Our room was clean but looked tired and in aid of remodelling and it was extremely small. We only had a double bed(all 4 other hotels we had stayed in had queen or king size beds in) and you could just manage to walk around the edge of it, the only place I could open my case was in the doorway. Our room, linen and towels were cleaned/changed daily and all staff were polite and helpful. We did not venture to the breakfast room as again I had a feeling and decided against it. The location of the hotel is good, as was the value and the room clean bit far too small. Our trip was busy so the room was only needed to sleep and shower in for 3 nights but if I was planning on staying in Vancouver for any longer I would not choose the Barclay.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ohkithaaaa
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. The price sounds too good to be true and it is too good to be true. My wife and I booked from the UK via the hotel website. When we turned up for our two night stay, my wife checked-in whilst I parked our car. When I wen to our room, she informed me that this was the second room we were given as the first was so terrible it almost made her cry. Having seen the disgusting state of the first room, she felt the second was better. Having not seen the first room, I almost cried at the state of the second room. The room smelt of freshly sprayed febreeze. After a minute in the room, the stench of cigarettes came through the febreeze and infused all of our clothes. The room was about 5foot by 8foot and cramped. All the furniture was old and tired and the carpet was filthy. The windows would not shut and posed a burglary risk. In all my days I have seen hostels which a 5star in comparison to this place. As an asthmatic, I had to leave the hotel as the cigarette smell was irritating my lungs. When we told the hotel owner that we were leaving because his hotel was disgusting, he did not seem suprised. I'm guessing he gets it all the time. He had the cheek to try and charge us $40. We told him where to go and he did not charge us. We went and checked in at the Empire Landmark next door; a much finer hotel. We found out that the various hotels next to the barclay frequently get people who have walked out of the barclay looking for a better room. The barclay is well located but that is all it has going for it. It is a total health hazard and I would advise you not to stay there if you're looking to have a nice holiday with your partner. Feel free to ask me any questions about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Falling short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: emikretep
Reviews.Content: The Hotel website and reality are a world apart ,whilst the linen towels etc were changed daily and the shower was a nice powerful one,the room was dark and dingy with a very creaky bed. The breakfast area was really gloomy and dark; infact the whole place is long over due a refurb. The location is excellent but it certainly is a strange hotel certainly one that you cannot relax in after a long journey. Luckily this was the first stop on our journey and all the other accomodations were great.But we will not be returning to the B arclay on any future visit.to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but much in need of improvements”
Reviews.Author: MAnchester61
Reviews.Content: The location on Robson Street is great. The room was clean but very drab, the bed was old and creaky. We stayed there at the start and end of our trip and had significant leaks in the bathrooms in both rooms. If you want a place just to sleep that is clean and convenient and cheap, then go ahead. If you want any luxury, then don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FarmX
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reasonable rates, for a stay of one week beginning May 22nd., 2008. I and a friend rented a Deluxe Twin room. In our case it meant that in addition to the usually hotet room, bed, two night tables,lamp, phone, clock radio, desk, chair, fridge, armoire containing a TV, with remote, as well as three clothes drawers, there was a second room. This second room was the inner room so there was no window to the outdoors. There was a nine panelled window(minus the glass) between the two rooms. Both rooms had doors which closed off the hallway. There was a clothes closet, with a door, in the hall way and the bathrooom,which had a window, was off the hallway. We were at the back of the hotel so that the bedroom window looked unto the court yard and the bathroom window looked out unto the alley. We had no issuses with noise and slept soundly. The hotel is old and worn but is was clean. The linens were scent free, a plus for me since I have asthma. No harsh chemicals were used in the cleaning of the bathroom or the rooms. There was no shortage hot water. All the staff were polite and helpful at all times. There was a true mixture of hotel guests with ages ranging from children under ten to those who have been senior citizens for a few years. I personally met people from North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. I have been to Vancouver more than forty times so I was well aware of the excellent location of the Barcly Hotel. The location allows one to walk to major shopping, Stanley Park, English Bay, numberous restaurants, bars, night clubs and the Skytrain. If you are not a big walker you can get public transit within one block of the hotel. I have travelled, literally ,around the world and have stayed in hotels that should have been burnt to the ground to one of the top ten hotels in the world(at the time). I really wonder about the travel experience of some of the people who write poor reviews of this hotel. They must be inexperienced in travel, do not understand rating systems, live with high expectations or are people who are just naturally negative, because this hotel is a good deal. Personally my only complaint is that the computer in the lobby was out of order too much. I suppose I could compain a bit about the bed not being smooth, but then neither are those of friends and family whom I visit. Those who have trouble with stairs should avoid this hotel unless they can be assurred that they will have a room on the first floor;however, they must keep in mind that you mush walk up a half flight of stairs from the street level to reach the lobby. The rooms are not spacious, but you are not paying spacious prices.My travelling friend was not happy with the lack of a parking lot near the hotel, which is not the hotel's fault. Yet, she was pleased enough with the hotel that she booked the same unit for another week after I had to leave. This hotel is a good deal and I will be staying there in 2009. J. M. Penny Halifax, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Affortable. Friendly. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: jermyg
Reviews.Content: Despite what has been written about this hotel...I am here to say it made my stay in Vancouver a pleasant one. It was more than I expected. The staff are friend, helpful and kind. After reading the reviews on this website I was scared to make the booking but I really needed an affortable hotel so I gave it a try. Yes, it is basic. It is not the Hilton, it's the Barclay. It is affortable. The rooms are small and clean. They provide fresh towels and bedding. Cable TV, a desk, telephone & alarm clock. What else can you ask, with that kind of price? I am from Toronto, Ontario and I assure you we do not have a hotel of the same quality, affortability and location. The Barclay is right in the heart of Vancouver on Robson Street. Close to many shops and restaurants. There's this little crepe restaurant (opens at 9am) right around the corner Robson/Jervis. If you are a budget traveler seeking a safe and clean hotel downtown, you are looking for The Barclay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: dsnm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few nights in October The room we had was a decent size and had an ensuite with bath. The room was not a bad size - had a cupboard and tv. Great location - only a short walk down Robson Street past shops and resturants. Didnt go for breakfast any morning but the sign said it was open till 10. Front desk staff were helpful in calling taxis, general questions etc I would stay at this hotel again. It was value for money and location for that price was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Staff and Dark”
Reviews.Author: MandyPB
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver in early January 2008. I walked passed this hotel and went in to enquire about a room. First of all let me say that this hotel is cheap (about CDN 40 a night for a single room with own bathroom) - in fact a local (who is a travel agent) advised me that this is probably the cheapest hotel in Vancouver. The location is also excellent. However, I did not end up booking this hotel for a few key reasons: 1) As a woman travelling alone, it just did not feel safe. I felt fine walking around the streets at night, so it was not the area. The hotel is dark and old and had a seedy atmosphere. 2) The ambiance of the hotel was bleak and depressing. If you are a traveller who will just use your room to sleep and have a quick shower, you will probably find this OK. But if you are a traveller who likes to relax in your room, watch TV, have a leisurely bath etc do yourself a favour and go to either the Listel or Blue Horizon up the road. 3) The gentleman at the front desk was most peculiar. He had a very fussy manner and did not exactly put you at ease. When I inspected the rooms, I tested the hardness of the bed by sitting on it and he chucked it and spent about 2 mins smoothing out non-existence wrinkles - you think he was running a 5 star joint the way he carried on. Also, one of the rooms I saw had the sink bedside the bed (eventhough there was a separate bathroom) - I find this kind of strange. I would definitely not recommend this hotel for women travelling alone or for anyone who requires a decent hotel to enjoy their holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Wonderful Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Travellsally
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barclay Hotel on arrival in Canada for a two week fly drive vacation. There were four adults and we had booked a suite. This was found to be large, spacious and clean and contained a double sofa bed and two queen beds. The bed linen was all spotless and the beds new. There was a bathroom with bath and shower, toilet and washbasin. In the living room, we found a fireplace, TV, writing desk, fridge and large leather sofa. We felt safe and secure for the two nights we spent in Vancouver before we picked up the hire car.There were also tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was available for a small charge and not free as I believe was previously stated on the website. The reception desk was also manned 24 hours. I must admit that after making the booking and then seeing the amount of negative reviews, I was rather apprehensive and even a little worried about what we would find on arrival. I do not know what people expect when they pay for a budget hotel. I can honestly say that I would recommend the Hotel. I am 46 years old and I am an avid traveller. I started travelling when I was 17 years old and have now been around the world twice, staying in hotels of all classes from Budget to First Class/5 star. I have flown in Economy and First Class. Our two night stay in The Barclay Suite cost us the grand total of £138. That is £69 per night for the room which worked out to £17.50 each [although the room could have accommodated two more if you did not mind doubling up and therefore make it cheaper] An absoloute Bargain !!! We were close to restaurants , shops and bars and within walking distance to Stanley Park and the Skytrain.

Reviews.Title: “Great good value and location for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: DK_Wiltshire
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Great location in downtown Vancouver with loads of restaurants and shops close by * Very good value for money (we paid 95 CAD per night excluding taxes, SMTW) * Water pressure for the shower was excellent for our ground floor room Cons: * Fixed shower head (ladies bewarned) * Could be noisy for some * Rooms could be considered as small for some, especially the bathroom (shower only, and no room for the sink which was located in the main room) Overall: Great find for a budget tourist hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, not bad at all for the price”
Reviews.Author: Vaskez
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was simply the only one at a reasonable price in that area of downtown Vancouver. I didn't expect much. Yeah, there is no lift, but that's fine, you shouldn't be taking loads of stuff unless you're staying for weeks on end, anyway. Also, the only downside really was that everything in the rooms is very old, like from the 70's. But if you don't mind old furniture and old phone, bathroom etc., it's all good. The staff were friendly and helpful- one night someone in the room next door left the TV on all night, I complained and it had been switched off when I was back, and had no more problems. The breakfast is extra, but very cheap and good. And the location is amazing - I walked to Stanley park in 15/20 minutes and you're right on the main shopping Street - Robson Street, and walking distance to the harbour as well. The bed was also fine, so yeah overall, I stayed for 6 nights in a double room, very nice for the price, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Price and location perfect”
Reviews.Author: dasberliner
Reviews.Content: Basic pension style hotel right on Robson Street, feels like you could be in London the minute you walk in the door, has a '50 quid a nite Earls Court hotel' feel about it. But room is clean, has it's own bathroom, and price and location far outway the relative tiredness of the building and hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Hitoshi
Reviews.Content: I and my friend picked this hotel up from Japanese travel guide book called "Chikyuu-no- Arukikata (How to walk on Globe)". Although the room we stayed was not so large, it has a space large enough to stay and sleep. In addition that, it was so cheap that we could save lots of money with booking this hotel. And location is great! It is located on the busiest street, Robson in Down town area. You can walk everywhere you want to go in Downtown Vancouver. Of couese you can catch a bus, seabus and sky train easily. Hitoshi and Sudin @ Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Sudin
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely Stayable, Sleepable hotel. We had no problems. The Hotel Location is great. Right on the Robson Street at the heart of downtown Vancouver. You can walk for a mile on Robson Street and it's full of shopping stores and restaurants. Downtown Vancouver is very Safe and Busy place. Major Night Clubs, Bars, SkyTrain, Seabus are all within 20 minutes walk from the hotel. High speed internet cafe "Robson Internet Place" is just a minute walk from the Hotel, just CAD$2.00 per hour. The hotel rooms have 60+ cable TV channels including multi cultural channels showing bollywood programs now and then. We had No problems with TV reception. Local phone calls from room cost 50 cents but there is pay phone on the lobby which will cost you 25 cents. Yes, there is No elevator but what's harm in climbing 2 or 3 flight of stairs? Its a great workout. Rooms are small compared to other hotels, so you will need to manage space if you have many luggage. There is Plenty of hot water for shower and Good room serivce. The Hotel has No free breakfast. It cost CAD$5 for breakfast buffet. Beds are comforable. Me and my friend were sleeping 9/10 hours everynight. I never heard any noise or disturbance. The airporter shuttle service (---) will bring you from airport to within a minute walk from the hotel. You can find all the necessary brochures and maps for travel and sight seeing in the hotel lobby. Reading some of the negative reviews about this hotel made it sound like this is a rotton hotel. It really is Not. It is a normal nice Hotel. Both me and my friend were impressed by the location, price and convinence of this hotel. We would definitely stay in this hotel again. - Sudin and Hitoshi, Los Angeles, November 2006

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life, don't waste your money here.”
Reviews.Author: Myrna19
Reviews.Content: I'll start with what I liked - the location. Now I'll list what I didn't like. 1. no lift and with heavy baggage that is a big turn off. 2. Air conditioner that sounded like a freight train - reported it and nothing happened. 3. Light fitting hanging by a thread from the ceiling. 4 cigarettes and matches in with the shampoo and conditioner - we'd requested a non smoking room. 5. Staff could not speak English well - communication difficult. 6. Electrical wiring very suspect in room. 7. Bad television reception. 8. Bathroom door would not close properly. 9. Very rude staff member when we were checking out. Never ever go to this place unless all other places have been booked out.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money But A Little Depressing”
Reviews.Author: dianehan
Reviews.Content: BARCLAY HOTEL ROBSON STREET VANCOUVER We stayed at the Barclay Hotel in July 2006. First impression was very disappointing, as it had been advertised as being elegant. I don't think so! To be fair to the hotel, we asked for a quiet room and we were given a choice of two. We opted for a room on the 3rd floor that was fairly large. The room was basic but clean, certainly no frills. The bathroom consisted of a bath with shower over, and a toilet. The hand basin was in the bedroom - very strange. The shower was very efficient, and there was plenty of hot water. The bed was comfortable and most important, clean. The staff were helpful especially the man on duty during the day. The position of the hotel is excellent, right amongst the hub of things, and the airport bus stopped at the hotel next door. I think if you do not set your expectations too high, you would find this hotel value for money although a little depressing.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there with my sister and we moved out after 30 mins. I plugged one thing in and the room's power went out. The window and the washroom are dirty. I was embarrased just being at that hotel. I got my money back but it was the most horrible moment of my travel.

Reviews.Title: “I felt cheated by the hotel making it an unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: xboxmarkster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barclay hotel from February 1st-13th 2006 and felt very deceived by the hotels website description. I was staying alone and every hotel that I have been to where I am staying alone I get a double bed at least and the barclays accomodation was terrible, the room was about the size of a extended broom cupboard and if I stood up to get out of the bed I was 2 steps away from the front door. The bed was not even a double as I had expected but to make matters worse it was not even a single it was more of a junior single bed that you give to a kid who is not ready for a full size bed yet with no duvet only 2 layers of sheets to cover me in the night which was difficult since my legs were hanging out of the end of the bed. The room was very very cramped and the bathroom condition was not up to standards. There were strange stains in the tub that I wont start to wonder what they were and it was obvious that they had been left since the last guest and not cleaned,the only plus side of this hotel was that it was right on Robson in the centre of all the action. The hotel was safe too which is another plus but do not be fooled by the website or other reviews,the local calls are not free and neither is the "complimentary breakfast" that costs $8.00 a time which you are not told about and each time you take what you think is free there is a invoice building at the front desk for you same with the so called "free local calls". Overall I was very disapointed with this hotel but on the plus side its on Robson location right in the heart of downtown made up for some of its let downs but not enough for me to want to ever go back check out the Listel or Landmark instead.

Reviews.Title: “It was awful!”
Reviews.Author: oslomamma
Reviews.Content: We moved out after 2 days to Landmark Hotel, just 1/2 a block down the street. We paid CAD20 more per night for a great standard! My husband who is used to hostel type accommodations even thought that this hotel was terrible. The carpets were stained, the cleanliness of the 'duvet' was questionable, and the bathroom was falling apart. We would never return to this hotel at any cost. The pictures on their website were definitely very misleading; the rooms looked cozier than it really is. If comfort is not not priority, and if you need a place just to sleep, I guess this hotel would meet your needs. But it's definitely not a place if you wish to spend time in your room. What an experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Real Bargain”
Reviews.Author: rdcjMD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite old and the rooms were cramped but very clean. The front desk staff were nice and extremely friendly. They can disarm the grouchiest hotel guest. The location was great. There were restaurants, grocery stores, internet cafes, you name it you can just walk to get there in minutes. I couldn't ask for more. Lest I forget, the breakfast was very cheap and bountiful with eggs and Canadian ham on the sides. All for CAD 5.00!!! I will definitely be back in this hotel next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: Zabelle
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fancy hotel , then this is not the hotel for you. But if you want a nice clean room with a comfortable bed then you can't do better than this. The location is perfect and the staff is friendly and helpful. There are good restaurants nearby and the bus goes right in front of the hotel. This is the best bargain on Robson. You can get breakfast at the hotel (it is an extended continental) or get a hot breakfast across the street. Rooms vary greatly in size and furnishing so if you want a bigger room ask for it. They also give a AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barclay last month and found it to be excellent for a hotel in this price range. The location can't be beat. My double room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was at the back of the hotel so I don't have any complains abt the street noise that the other reviewers had. I would return should I ever find myself in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, convenient, cosy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel had a warm atmosphere and friendly staff to go with it. It's on the quieter end of Robson street so it's not that noisy. Yet it's minutes from the all the action of downtown - restaurants, bars, theatres, shops, you name it. The rooms weren't fancy, but were very clean and comfortable. Great value for travellers on a budget. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Barclay is great for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barclay last July and I thought it was pretty good for what I paid--just over $40.00 Canadian per night. The staff were very friendly and helpful and welcoming, and no credit card was required to stay (just a $50.00 deposit.) It kinda sucks that there's no elevator, but that was a small price to pay to save a ton of money. The room was immaculate, but decorated poorly. It was kinda tacky actually, but who cares? I was in Vancouver to see the city, not my hotel room. The air conditioner was very welcome as most buildings in Vancouver are not air conditioned and I arrived in the middle of an unusual heat wave. There was a colour tv with cable, a bathtub and shower and plenty of storage for clothing etc. The room was spacious. There's a piano bar, but it was always empty. However, it's on Robson street, so there's always a place to go just outside the door. I'd really recommend this place to people travelling on a budget, especially in a city like Vancouver which can be pretty expensive. I think students would have a great time here as it seems there are a lot of young people staying here. As for the noise, I didn't even notice it. Robson isn't THAT noisy at night. It's no different from any other city. Cities make noise, people!!! I'm definitely going to stay at the Barclay on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Barclay is, by far, the cheapest downtown hotel in Vancouver. You are within walking distance from trendy to small restaurants. Close to malls, etc. The fact that its right on Robson street makes it pretty noisy. If you like people watching and don't mind noise, get a room facing the street. The rooms are small with shower only- although you can get suites with everything. This is not a dumpy hotel!! If you just want to be in the action this is the place. I would go back if I could get a room!! Earplugs are a must!!

Reviews.Title: “charming and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surfing the web for info about the Barclay Hotel on Robson in Vancouver. I stayed there when I relocated to Vancouver 8 years ago and I found it charming and economical. I will stay there again when I return to BC. The staff was helpful and friendly and the rooms aren't large or luxurious but, I think it's a great value for the dollar and the location is awesome, right across the street from the much more expensive Pacific Pallisades.

HotelInfo.Name: Barclay Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1348 Robson Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 1C5, Canada
